International aid is being mobilized, with the WFP dispatching emergency supplies and India airlifting relief materials to assist affected communities.

Pillow Nebula explained: NASA uncovers four-cornered structure; Hubble captures it
description: NGC 7027, also known as the Pillow Planetary Nebula, is a bright, compact nebula located 3,000 light-years away in Cygnus. Its unique four-cornered shape, possibly caused by a central binary star system, makes it a target for scientific study and astrophotography. This nebula provides insights into stellar life cycles and the chemical enrichment of space.

title: Too many students, too few teachers in Karnataka
description: A whopping 85,495 teaching posts are vacant across government-run educational institutions in Karnataka, with guest faculty making up for them. On Teachers’ Day, Jayanth R. looks at its debilitating impact on quality of education

title: Himachal rain fury: Landslip in Kullu leaves 1 dead, 6 buried
description: A total of 1,212 roads are closed in Himachal Pradesh, of which 289 were blocked in Mandi, 231 in Kullu, 211 in Shimla, 192 in Chamba district

title: Trump to seek 'Department of War' rebranding for Pentagon
description: When confronted with the possibility that making the name change would require an act of Congress, Mr. Trump told reporters that “we're just going to do it".

description: The combined 655 runs scored was the most ever in an ODI at Lord's but that was scant consolation for England

title: US Open 2025: Bhambri's dream run ends in semis
description: Joe Salisbury and Neal Skupski of Britain triumphed over India's Yuki Bhambri and Michael Venus in a thrilling US Open semifinal. After dropping the first set, the British pair rallied to win 6(2)-7, 7-6(5), 6-4. Bhambri and Venus, despite a strong tournament run including impressive victories, couldn't maintain their early lead.

title: WH pushes 'warrior ethos': Trump revives 'dept of war'; Hegseth gets new title
description: Donald Trump has renamed the US department of defence to the department of war. The White House stated that Trump will sign an executive order. This permits the use of the new title as a secondary name. Pete Hegseth will be known as the secretary of war. Pentagon websites and signage will also be updated. Trump mentioned the history of victory associated with the department of war.

title: Govt revamps GST: Rates reduced on nearly 400 goods — Here’s how cuts will reach consumers by Sept 22
description: Following the government's GST rate reductions on numerous goods and services, Indian companies are adjusting prices to benefit consumers by September 22. FMCG firms may increase product quantity for fixed-price items. White goods companies anticipate a demand surge, while hotels offer reduced rates for check-in payments. Car dealers, however, face potential losses due to existing inventory and revised cess structures.

title: Battered North India logs its rainiest 2-week period in 14 years
description: North India experienced unprecedented rainfall between August 22 and September 4, with nearly three times the normal amount. This intense spell, the wettest in at least 14 years, triggered devastating floods in Punjab, record Yamuna levels in Delhi, and landslides in the Himalayas.

A video circulating online purportedly captures Pawar instructing Krishna to halt action against an NCP member involved. Opposition leaders are demanding an apology, alleging Pawar threatened the officer after she insisted on verifying his identity.

description: Rishi Nair, a 19-year-old BITS Pilani Goa student from Bengaluru, was found dead in his hostel room, marking the fifth student death in ten months. Police report Rishi was battling depression following his girlfriend's suicide. His parents had moved him to the Goa campus for support.

'You can’t talk to India, China like that': Putin hits back at Trump's tariff
description: Vladimir Putin has cautioned the United States against using tariffs and sanctions to pressure India and China, emphasizing that the colonial era is over and such tactics are inappropriate. He accused the Trump administration of attempting to weaken the leadership of these nations through economic pressure, noting their historical sensitivities and strong domestic political systems.

Pickles or whisky? Pickle parcel scam to dry Bihar unmasked
description: Ahead of Bihar's assembly elections, liquor smuggling attempts are escalating. Railway Protection Force seized a 'pickle' shipment at Varanasi Junction, uncovering 283 whisky bottles destined for Patna. This follows previous incidents, including the discovery of 316 bottles on the Lucknow-Barauni Express and arrests in Gorakhpur, highlighting intensified efforts to smuggle alcohol into the dry state.

Sheena Bora murder trial: Indrani Mukerjea's daughter Vidhie concludes deposition
description: In the Sheena Bora murder trial, Vidhie Mukerjea concluded her deposition, alleging financial misconduct by stepbrothers and drug abuse by Rahul Mukerjea. She admitted to writing a book influenced by misinformation and expressed regret over its contents. Vidhie also cited "privileged information" when questioned about a New Zealand bank account and denied knowledge of specific financial dealings involving her parents.

‘Armed soldiers should not police citizens’: DC sues Trump
Suspect in killing of Israeli embassy staffers in Washington pleads not guilty
'Baaghi 4' advance BO collection day 1: Tiger Shroff, Sanjay Dutt starrer makes comeback
description: Tiger Shroff's 'Baaghi 4', also starring Sanjay Dutt, is poised for a strong opening, with advance bookings nearing 2 lakh tickets. The film has already grossed ₹7.4 crore in advance sales, with Maharashtra, Delhi NCR, and Gujarat leading in bookings.

title: Happy teachers' day: Top 50 wishes, messages to share with your teachers
description: India celebrates Teachers' Day on September 5th, commemorating Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan's birth anniversary. This day honors teachers' profound impact, shaping students' minds, character, and futures. From academic guidance to life lessons, teachers inspire and empower. Heartfelt wishes, messages of gratitude, and inspirational quotes are shared to express appreciation for their dedication and influence, recognizing their role as mentors and guides.

title: Giorgio Armani dies at 91: Built a $10 billion fashion empire
description: Giorgio Armani, the iconic Italian fashion designer renowned for his elegant and sophisticated designs, has passed away at the age of 91. Credited with redefining modern Italian style through minimalist designs and timeless sophistication, Armani's creations graced red carpets and boardrooms alike. He built his independent fashion house into a global powerhouse, leaving an indelible mark on the fashion world.

title: Punjab floods: CM Mann catches fever, skips tour of affected areas; toll 43
description: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, down with viral fever, missed accompanying Arvind Kejriwal on a tour of flood-affected areas. Kejriwal, after visiting Mann, assessed the flood situation in Sultanpur Lodhi. His visit coincides with controversy surrounding AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, accused of rape and other charges. Pathanmajra's arrest attempt sparked a political row, with allegations of revenge politics surfacing.

title: ScaleAI lawsuit: Mark Zuckerberg-backed firm sues ex-employee; data theft allegations surface
description: Former Scale AI employee, Eugene Ling, apologizes to his new team at Mercor as Scale AI sues him for allegedly stealing confidential documents. The lawsuit claims Ling took over 100 documents containing customer strategies and attempted to poach a major client. Ling denies nefarious intent, stating he was instructed not to delete the files when he offered.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
description: The GST Council has approved a revised two-tier rate structure, reducing the slabs to 5% and 18%, effective September 22. Consumer electronics like TVs, air conditioners, and dishwashers will see a price cut as they move from the 28% to the 18% GST slab. However, mobile phones and laptops will continue to be taxed at 18%.

title: Gretzky and Canada’s identity: Why he no longer defines hockey
description: Wayne Gretzky, once the undisputed symbol of Canadian hockey, is now being re-evaluated as the sport evolves. While his legacy remains significant, the rise of international stars and Canada's changing role in the global game have sparked an identity crisis. Canadians are urged to embrace a future where their hockey identity extends beyond a single figure.

title: After paralysis, Reese Ketler hears a doctor’s unexpected message
description: In 2019, Reese Ketler's hockey career ended abruptly due to a spinal cord injury. Doctors initially feared he might never walk again. Through intensive rehab and unwavering determination, Ketler defied expectations and returned home early. Now, he inspires thousands as a content creator, proving life continues after tragedy and sharing a message of hope and resilience.

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; Staff must report personal usage
description: Amazon is monitoring employee phone usage. Workers must now report the percentage of work-related use on company phones. Reimbursements will be adjusted accordingly. This is part of cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy. Employees are expressing concerns about micromanagement. Amazon defends the policy as a return to its performance-driven roots. Other companies are also tightening expense policies.
